name: Hyatt Regency Huntington Beach Resort & Spa

reviews.text: Beautiful beaches. Beautiful weather in Surf City USA!
reviews.title: Four Star Fun in Huntington Beach

reviews.text: The hubby and I just returned from a midweek stay at the Hyatt. I have to say it was one of the most enjoyable beach getaways I've ever had. The weather was gorgeous (74 and sunny each day), the beach (right across the street) was clean and lovely, and the grounds of the hotel were extremely well kept. The spa was lovely -- quality services and amenities without any pretension or snobbery whatsoever. The pool area is great too -- a nice soundtrack plays gently in the background as you nap, drink, eat, swim, etc.
reviews.title: Outstanding Getaway

reviews.text: The rooms are lovely -- we had one overlooking the beach. What a wonderful view to wake up to. Just totally relaxing. The room was quiet and comfortable. The Regency Club (available to guests staying on the 4th floor) was a very convenient place to grab morning coffee and munchies, as well as a glass of wine at the evening cocktail hour. The concierge was also extremely helpful in helping us find restaurants in the area for dinner.
reviews.title: I LOVE THIS PLACE

reviews.text: We will definitely be back to this outstanding property.
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.disliked: — Very spread out -- long walks for those with difficulty getting around

reviews.text: I am SO going back here.
reviews.title: Feces in the Jacuzzi!
Excellent
reviews.text: I loved this hotel. The grounds are beautiful. The beds were comfortable. the spa is really beautiful and the workout equipment first rate. It is right across the street from the ocean. It has a retail court with some nice shops. I would definitely stay here again. There were a lot of people at the hotel but it is so spread out one doesnt feel overwhelmed. Great place.

I stayed at the Hyatt Regency with my husband and 18 month old son for Memorial Day weekend. We were quite impressed with the size and the condition of the property. It is huge, well kept and is truly like a retreat. We stayed in a beautiful room overlooking the ocean and the pool. The grounds were beautiful everywhere. The spa area was very peaceful. The conference grounds were beautiful. We actually saw at least 4 weddings in only 2 days! It seems to be a "wedding factory"!
reviews.title: Nice Getaway For a Weekend

reviews.text: The location was perfect for us because it was about 1 mile away from the Pier and Main Street where all the commotion is and also close enough to walk over for exercise and a meal. There is an 8 mile walkway along the beach that enables you to walk for miles in either direction in front of the hotel. The bridge that they have built allowing access to the beach is wonderful.
reviews.title: I want to go back now!

likes.disliked: — extra charges, no comp high speed internet.

reviews.text: There are many convenient drug stores, markets etc... very close to the hotel. Dozens of restaurants on Main Street from sushi, pub grub, to fine dining. However if you want some peace and quiet stay at the hotel or go elsewhere. The Hyatt has a wonderful restaurant - The Californian and a very relaxing wine bar called the Red Chair Room. The pool is quite large and the food around the pool is very reasonable compared to many other resorts we have stayed at. The Grocery Store on the Hyatt grounds is useful but very pricey. The pizza place (Tower 15) is just a hole in the wall. The casual dining restaurant (Pete's Sunset Grille) was horrible. The service was so bad that we had to ask 3 different waiters to bring a high chair as we just stood by our table. At that time there were only 2 small tables of guests being waited on I might add! The food was just greasy, cheap and an insult to the Hyatt. My son's macaroni and cheese looked like it was weeks old and his chicken was so battered that it was hard to find where the chicken was.You would be suprised to know that I am hardly a picky eater and have eaten in all sorts of places, but this was unacceptable.
reviews.title: Mega Hotel Does A Good Job

likes.disliked: — The waterfall shower in the women's spa was broken...:(

reviews.text: The room was very large and had a very comfortable bed, nice balcony, refrigerator (empty - useful), spacious bathroom, my favourite Portico bath products, and an office, desk, couch area.
reviews.title: Nothing special, overpriced, overcrowded

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel as a treat for a friend celebrating a milestone. Very nice hotel. Fairly pricey for what you get, but that's probably common for the area.
reviews.title: Lovely Spot!

reviews.text: Rooms are average, and are of average size with a fairly "basic" bathroom. No honor bar, but a fridge. No flat screen tv, but nice enough. The beds, however, are outstanding. Very comfortable and luxurious. The rooms are pretty quiet. Nice balcony, and nice view, lovely grounds, nice lobby. The maids came early the first morning and when I told them we were missing our DND sign they didn't pay attention and did it AGAIN the next morning, until they finally gave me a DND sign to hang on the door. They did a nice job with the rooms though, and nice turndown service. Never ate at any restaurants, and in general they close too early. Ordered only a glass of wine and utensils from room service and they were very prompt. Exeedingly so.
reviews.title: Great Southern California Destination

likes.liked: — Spa, beach, pool, proximity to town and pier

reviews.text: Service was very good with the exception of the concierge who was not helpful at all when we were trying to plan a late night dinner after having attended "Wicked" in Bev Hills. Other than that though, staff was friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: A wonderful visit!

reviews.text: Concierge lounge was nice, and is well worth it I think. There isn't really a concierge available in there though, as was advertised and I've seen in some other concierge lounges.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort!

reviews.text: Valet was pretty fast except during checkout time, but you are really "forced" to use it and it is $25/night. There is no self park that I noticed. Lots of valet staff and pretty fast though.
reviews.title: We were impressed with the Hyatt

reviews.text: Valet service excellent,yes you pay ,but so handy always fast and thankyou tom who organised a scratch on car to be buffed out for us when he did not need to well done .front desk polite friendly and very efficient . Concierge and bell boys excellent lots of information and never forgot a name.housekeeping room was spotless all the time .resort is spotless with lots to do all the time especially with chrildren .thankyou hyatt for a wonderful stay.
reviews.title: Could not be better

reviews.text: Families cannot go wrong here. The service, food, retail shops, and overall experience is heavenly. I'm generally "water slide phobic," but I had as great a time as the kids. The beach is incredible, and if you get too much of the hotel food you can eat at the Wahoo Fish Taco shack directly across the street from the hotel. Some of the things you have to decide each day.
reviews.title: Perfect Family Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Waterslide - at the nicest family pool I've ever been to.
reviews.title: The best vacation Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Huntington Beach - without paying for parking.
reviews.title: May stay in Huntington Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Roasting marshmallows in pits scattered around the resort.
reviews.title: Beautiful View!!!

reviews.text: This is a great place to stay. Their facilities are very clean and very well kept. The location could not be better. Huntington Beach is directly across the Pacific Coast highway and accessible directly via a bridge right from the hotel property. The food is suspect, as was the service in the bar/restaurant. However, the real problem, and maybe the only problem, at this place are the fees. First, a $25 resort fee. I booked this for work and was in the hotel for only about 7 hours per night. So, these fees seem excessive. Second, the only overnight parking option is valet. There simply isn't anywhere else to park overnight. The hotel clearly knows this, and they charge $36 per night. Then, as if the $36 wasn't forced down your throat enough, the valet people stand around, hovering for a tip. Sorry pals, I was forced to pay an outrageous fee for parking, maybe you should ask Hyatt for a raise.
reviews.title: Great Property, be ready for the fees

reviews.text: The service was friendly from the check in process...thanks Jen, bell boys(Sean), maid(Carmenita) and attendants on a very busy weekend with weddings, conferences, etc. We had the Huntington suite which was spacious and located near the spa. I loved the bath products and they serve starbucks coffee.
reviews.title: "ahh...staycation!"

reviews.text: The property grounds are lovely and well cared for. The hotel is located across the street from the beach and I was concerned that we would hear the traffic from PCH in our room, you could only hear it on the balcony. The club room located on the 4th floor had a concierge, drinks, snacks, laptops and is available as an upgrade of $50.00 per day. The fees are pricey and many from the $34 valet, resort and city taxes.
reviews.title: My favorite place to stay!

reviews.text: The restaurants are average but we were so relaxed and apt to stay on the property than wait through the process of getting our car on such a busy weekend. The spa was wonderful and we enjoyed the couples massage and facility.
reviews.title: Recoup after our road trip

reviews.text: We encountered a technical issue with our suite doorbell going off at 3am and maintenance having to enter our room to find it and unplug it. I t wasn't handled well upon check-out but customer service rectified the problem.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel across from the Beach

reviews.text: Hotel was beautiful, room were nice, neat and clean. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Great location.
reviews.title: Beautiful!

likes.liked: — Location - right across from the beach.
likes.disliked: — Reservations Desk needs to clearly explain discounts

reviews.text: Problem, when i made the reservation, the woman who helped me told me what the price would be if I used my mother's AARP card. It came out to be $40 less a night. So I said great lets do this and booked. Was told that I have to bring the AARP card to the front desk when I was checking out.
reviews.title: Great hotel - but shame about the view

reviews.text: the second night we were there, mom realized she forgot her card. So I asked the front desk if they will accept a faxed copy or do they need the actual card. I was told that there is no AARP discount on the reservation and they cannot change it now. It would have had to be done at reservation. There was nothing he could do about it.
reviews.title: Loved the Hyatt!!!

likes.liked: — Room, view, pool, beach, restaurants, service

reviews.text: I called the 800 number. Was told that they couldn't do anything for me and that I should talk to the front desk. I hung up and called again to hopefully get someone else who was more helpful. They forwarded me to a manager. The manager explained to me that they do not accept AARP. they have a senior citizen discount and that is for people 62 and older. My mom is 61. So now I'm stuck paying an extra $40 a night and no one will compensate me.
reviews.title: Great location on the beach.

likes.disliked: — Very expensive and then you had to pay for internet access.

reviews.text: At checkout, Karen (at the front desk) listened to my situation and gladly gave me discount. I love her for that!!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a nice property with a great location, but it could have been a better stay. About a mile from the pier and across PCH from the beach on a foot bridge…Hard to go wrong. It is a nice property, but it is a little tattered. At check in we were sent to the wrong room, had to wait for our new key to be brought to us. Ocean view room had the typical teeny slice of a view. Got food poisoning from room service, up all night vomiting. $25 resort fee, $34 valet parking fee. Damn. I am a Hyatt Diamond member and it really did nothing for me. Did not have the newspaper delivered. Room was missing a laundry bag, note pad and pen. I don’t typically care about that stuff until I need it.
reviews.title: Too big. Tattered. Extra fee's add no value.

reviews.text: Above all, I think what bothered me most is that the property is just too big. Too many weddings and too many people. All that being said, it is still better than the property next door and I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, fantastic location!

reviews.text: I stayed recently for a convention. What a perfect facility. From the moment you drive up, you are treated like royalty. Valet and bell staff are very friendly and attentive. Check in was very fast. The rooms were spacious and beautiful. I don't think there is a bad view in the whole place! Spas and pools were very nice. Pool bar and grill were very good. It was very relaxing. They have little nooks with couches and fireplaces, where you can gather and hang out with people. The bridge to the beach is perfect! The resort is very clean, there are staff cleaning walls and railings everywhere. And all of them are friendly, taking time to stop and say hello. This is one of the best properties I have ever stayed in. Would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Great resort hotel, even for business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just completed another stay here during a business trip and have to say this is one of the best Hyatt properties I have seen (and I'm a diamond member). The resort itself is beautiful and well kept. The rooms are spacious and most have a view of the ocean.
reviews.title: The best

reviews.text: The inside bar is great for cocktails with business associates, and the wait staff at the Californian restaurant provided incredible service.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I've stayed in. Perfect for families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great property and service, just be prepared to get dinged with the resort fee of $25/day and valet parking of $34/night. Tip: Because we had two cars, we parked one of them on nearby Beach Boulevard (about a half mile away) to avoid having to pay for parking both.
reviews.title: Fabulous staycation!

reviews.text: The hotel is located right across the street from the beach and on an amazing jogging path alongside the water. It's only a 1 mile walk to the pier, so the location was great. The line for cabs was long (we were there for a conference) but there was an easy shuttle for only $3 to take us right to the Pier and a ph# to call to pick back up. Much better option than a cab. I was struck by how NICE all the staff was... and it seemed so genuine. Maybe they're just naturally happy west coasters or well trained, but either way the staff was super-friendly.
reviews.title: VERY friendly service, Beautiful Hotel
Great Hotel...Perfect for Wedding Activities in So Cal.
reviews.text: Stayed here during a very busy wedding weekend. Hotel upgraded rooms for our party and we were right next to pool. Staff was very accomodating. Spent time at the pool, in the spa, and took pre-wedding photos here with the whole wedding party and family. Only complaint would be lack of parking. Cost $19.00 a day/$29.00 overnight or $17.00 a day across the street in the beach parking lot.

My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt with our 9 month old daughter for a week. Our stay couldn't have been better, the premises were absolutely amazing, and the service definitely sets the bar high. We stayed from Sunday to Sunday, and especially during the week when it was quiet, it felt like we had personal service in all restaurants and pool area.
reviews.title: Excellent stay at the Hyatt in Huntington Beach

reviews.text: Only complaints I have are the valet parking price, and that you can only have two devices connected to the internet. As we are from Europe, and data roaming costs are ridiculous in the US, it would've been nice to have our cell phones, ipad and laptop connected. Especially since the internet already costs extra (included in the extra resort fee). Self parking on the beach was ok, 15$ a night with in and out priviledges. If you park right next to the pedestrian bridge, the walk to the room isn't that bad.
reviews.title: A wonderful place to stay for a relaxing vacation!

aka: Hyatt Regency Huntington Beach Resort And Spa
description: Located in a community also known as "Surf City, USA", the resort offers easy access via a pedestrian walkway to eight miles of wide beaches where waves crash and surfers reign. The magnificent Andalusian architecture, reminiscent of Spain's southern coast, and lush landscaping combine to create a sense of casual elegance and your own private seaside retreat. All rooms have private terraces, and most feature stunning views of the Pacific.
